html: They shall lament - for the pleasant fields "Mourn ye for the pleasant field"—, The Septuagint, Syriac, and Vulgate read ,ספדו , siphdu, mourn ye, imperative; twelve MSS., (five ancient), two editions, the Septuagint, Aquila, Symmachus, Theodotion, Syriac, and Vulgate, all read ,שדה , sadeh, a field; not ,שדי , shedey, breasts.
